intro: Psychotria meridianomontana var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with elliptic to ovate leaves that are often glabrous. Its flowers are small and clustered in cymes, with white or pale green petals. This variety is notable for its ecological significance in cloud forest ecosystems.
